sequence:
Another Leader?

<size=45>Chapter 4 - The Knight Commander's Leadership</size>

scripts.say: When I talk to King George V, I sometimes feel like she is the de facto leader of the Royal Navy.
During a sortie...
Interesting attack you have there!
Stay calm! Make no mistakes. I shall ensure both victory and the safety of all my comrades!
Even on the battlefield, she often leads the forces of the Royal Navy.
Port - Harbor Entrance
Let's get this shipment over to Warehouse #3.
Also, make sure to let the Eagle Union representative know that our joint exercise is still on for next week. Even though Her Majesty will be out, I'll take charge in her stead.
She even takes care of many of the responsibilities normally handled by Queen Elizabeth...
Port - Main Plaza
Norfolk, is everything all right? Did you have a bad dream?
Uhh... Don't think so...
If there's something on your mind, let's hear it. Maybe I might be able to help.
...Sure!
Even during her leisure time, she still helps others work out their problems or conflicts.
Port - Royal Navy Dorms
Are you saying that King George V acts more like Her Majesty than, well, Her Majesty?
While dining with some members of the Royal Navy, I candidly offered my observations from the last few days to Hood.

options.content: That isn't what I was trying to get at...

scripts.say: Perhaps she should be more aware of her boundaries. What say you, George?
No, Commander, thank you for being frank with your observations. If those were the conclusions you made, then we indeed have a problem.
I see... That may not have been my intention at all, but if the Commander made that observation, then surely others must have as well.
As she said this, she emerged from the kitchen with plates of freshly-prepared food in her hands.
